inclusion.criterion: age of ≥18 years, suspected heart rhythm disorder, and no previous diagnosis of rhythm disorder.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: patients had a 12-channel ECG record performed at the first visit. If a rhythm disturbance was detected at that time, the patient was treated according to the guidelines and was not included in the study.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: the investigators divided participants into two groups: the test group and control group, where the patients in the test group received a wearable device.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: patients who met these criteria were invited to participate in a study that was approved by the Ethics Committee of the Republic of Slovenia (number 0120-299/2017-7, KME 47/06/17), and written informed consent confirmed their participation.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: the Personal Digital Mobile Body Sensor is listed in the medical device category, has the status of a medical device with all necessary certifications, and is owned by Savvy.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: the ECG sensor consists of two electrodes, which are placed 8.5 cm apart, and measures the potential between these two closely placed body-surface electrodes.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: the measurement is transmitted via Bluetooth connection to a smartphone, where the device is paired and managed via the MobECG mobile application.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: the user can monitor the heart rate on the meter display with a curve and calculate it on an ongoing basis.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: the measurements are collected on the phone and can be transmitted to the physician in two ways: (1) pressing the button, the user can prepare a PDF report and send it to the physician's e-mail address or (2) transfer the data via USB cable to the physician's computer.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: the recordings can show different disorders but need to be evaluated so that artefacts can be distinguished from the actual disturbance of the rhythm.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: VisECG enables us to review and accurately analyze the recording and produce a report that can be submitted to physicians of other specialities for consultation or delivered to the patient and his or her physician as a measurement result.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: the study included the patients and their family physician.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: age less than 18 years, on examination on the ECG, the patient was not in sinus rhythm, and that the patient has a known heart rhythm disorder and / or is being treated for it.
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient is a 19-year-old Hispanic female with no specific past medical issues. She uses prenatal vitamins and has a family history of DM type 2 and HTN.
